paragraphs: Buy Activision and Electronic Arts Stocks Because New Consoles Are on the Way, Analyst Says
Activision stock has gained 25% this year. Photograph by Troy Harvey/Bloomberg
Two of the biggest videogame stocks, Activision Blizzard and Electronic Arts, are down from where they were two years ago. That could change in 2020.

Next-generation consoles from Microsoft (ticker: MSFT) and Sony (SNE) are slated to debut during the holiday season next year. The 12 months before a console hits shelves brought market-beating gains for game publishers in 2000, 2005, and 2013. After all, when everyone’s buying a shiny new console, they will need new games to play.

Activision stock (ticker: ATVI) has gained 25% this year, while Electronic Arts stock (EA) is up 34%. The S&P 500 index has gained 27%. SunTrust Robinson Humphrey analyst Matthew Thornton has Buy ratings on both stocks.
